TopicTitle: Can I send info to a sattelite?

Articles.Content:
Hey, I've been playing for about 2 weeks now, and have had a lot of fun! But that's besides the point. I recently had a sorta good attempt to land on Eve, and crashed my rover, but still got there in tact, and flipped over, but I don't mind. I want to know if there is any way to send the info from my Rover, like temperature, to a lab on my IKK (ISS, but called International Kerbal Kraft lol), instead of straight back to Kerbin. I don't want to transmit it to Kerbin, but instead to a sattelite, but NOT to Kerbin. The IKK has a Mobile Processor lab on it and I want to get extra science from the data on the lab....any one know how???

 

Thanks it advanced,

                                 PewPewTrash

Edited April 22, 2018 by PewPewTrash

Data can be transmitted, but unfortunately it will only be relayed to the KSC and counted as science accumulated at that time. It can't be accepted by any other craft along the way. The only way to transport dataq to an intermediary for processing is by physically carrying it on another ship.

If you are on PC, there is a mod that will let you transmit science from the instrument to an MPL. It's called "Science Relay" and is available on CKAN as well as the usual sources, linked in this thread:

Note that the linked thread has several small "modlets" including "Science Relay"

 

Edited April 22, 2018 by StrandedonEarth
